Elie's shoes as much as you possibly can;
although it is painful for us to do and it's not
easy I want you to do that. That is why I am
teaching you this book. So try not to just read it
on the surface, put yourself in it, put yourself
in the role of Elie. That's what he wants you to
do, that's why it's first person! That's why he
is the protagonist and the survivor and the
author- it's all intentional. He wants you to
experience it as awful as you possibly can, so
that you know how bad it is. So we made a comment
yesterday, "no survivor could begin to tell a
spark of the flame of the story", right? So even
though we're never gonna understand it
completely or be able to put ourselves in the
shoes completely, put yourselves in his shoes
as much as you possibly can, because if you know
how bad it was and you're feeling these emotions
that Elie makes you feel, then you're not gonna
let something like this happen. Like I told you,
you guys are the future, you guys are gonna grow
up and you have to be the ones who don't hate, who
don't discriminate, those of you- you guys all
have to be the ones who are accepting of tolerant
and teach your friends and your children those
things so that nothing like this ever happens
again. So I caution you from just reading this on
the surface. Read this deeper than any book
you've read and will read this year and put
yourself in his shoes, relate as much as you
possibly can. Any comments, there? Any
questions, there? Do you think it's gonna be
hard to do?

<text text-anchor="start" x="20004" y="-353.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think it, kind of, shows that he's just one out</text>

<polygon fill="mediumseagreen" stroke="none" points="16012,-1585.5 16012,-1672.5 16289,-1672.5 16289,-1585.5 16012,-1585.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16020" y="-1655.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> He doesn't want to make a mistake and ask the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16018" y="-1640.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> wrong questions and offend someone, if that be</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16020" y="-1625.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> his father or anyone in his family. Some of the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16019.5" y="-1610.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> questions could be "Why are Jews getting their</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16035.5" y="-1595.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> stuff taken, why are they getting taken?".</text>

<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="16002,-1468 16002,-1510 16300,-1510 16300,-1468 16002,-1468"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16081.5" y="-1492.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 69 - STUDENT 9</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16113" y="-1477.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="16002,-1306 16002,-1468 16300,-1468 16300,-1306 16002,-1306"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16027" y="-1450.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I don't think it’s necessarily about asking the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16047.5" y="-1435.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> wrong questions, but asking the right</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16027" y="-1420.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> questions to get the right answers. like that’s</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16030.5" y="-1405.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> what makes it so dramatic. Seeing all these</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16032.5" y="-1390.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> things that he saw, I think he's questioning</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16027.5" y="-1375.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> everything and that includes his religion and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16024" y="-1360.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> because he doesn't believe and because you're</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16026" y="-1345.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> not supposed to question he's struggling with</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16008" y="-1330.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that and he wants to ask why but he doesn't want to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16032.5" y="-1315.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> go against his religion, go against himself.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="16001,-1468 16001,-1468 16301,-1468 16301,-1468 16001,-1468"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="16001,-1305 16001,-1511 16301,-1511 16301,-1305 16001,-1305"/>

<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="16005,-1070.5 16005,-1217.5 16297,-1217.5 16297,-1070.5 16005,-1070.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16041" y="-1200.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think that it's not unnatural- forgetting</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16023.5" y="-1185.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> about the holocaust like just as a normal teen.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16030.5" y="-1170.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Like they question a lot about their life and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16031" y="-1155.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> what they've been taught, so I don't believe</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16018.5" y="-1140.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> questioning his god was wrong for him to do, it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16024" y="-1125.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> was more natural for him to do, but given the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16032" y="-1110.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> situation with the holocaust too, I think it's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16011" y="-1095.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> even more apparent for him to question the god as</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16137" y="-1080.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> well</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="16082" y="-1007.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 72 - STUDENT 5</text>

<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="16010,-865.5 16010,-982.5 16293,-982.5 16293,-865.5 16010,-865.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16027.5" y="-965.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think him questioning his god really shows</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16016" y="-950.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> just how big the holocaust was, I guess. Because</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16025" y="-935.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> he was so religious he didn't want to question</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16032" y="-920.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> anything but once it was happening he was</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16037" y="-905.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> questioning it. In the introduction he was</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16027" y="-890.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> almost losing faith because of how terrible it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16143" y="-875.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> is.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="16039.5" y="-760.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think he's questioning it all because he</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="16021" y="-730.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> everything that he's giving is for a purpose and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16020.5" y="-715.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that's what God has sent him through. It's what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16041" y="-700.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> he's putting him through, but he doesn't</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="16023" y="-685.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> understand why he's putting him through that.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="16342" y="-760.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I was just going to say, going off of Student 27</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="16009" y="-345.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think it was hard for him to even think about how</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="12675.5" y="-2872.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 82 - STUDENT 12</text>

<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="12614,-2746 12614,-2848 12882,-2848 12882,-2746 12614,-2746"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12632" y="-2830.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think we can relate to it in a certain way</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12620" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> because of things that have been happening in</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12633" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> this world lately like all the shootings, he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12621.5" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> thinks you can relate back to that with people</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12638" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> being fought for certain beliefs and that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="12693.5" y="-2755.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> stuff, just like him.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="11025.5" y="-2902.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 86 - STUDENT 13</text>

<polygon fill="mediumseagreen" stroke="none" points="10955,-2716 10955,-2878 11241,-2878 11241,-2716 10955,-2716"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10974" y="-2860.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I would say that I think you're right, it's very</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="11002" y="-2845.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> hard for us to relate to the specific</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10987.5" y="-2830.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> experiences that he tries to tell us in the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10974.5" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> course of the book, but I think there is some</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10965.5" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> aspect that you can relate to, I think he was just</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10968.5" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> crying to get across, there's always going to be</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10961" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> pure evil and pure good in the world, this is what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10979" y="-2755.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> pure evil can do, I think that's what he was</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10986.5" y="-2740.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> trying to relate to us. Because that's still</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="11010" y="-2725.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> everywhere in our world today.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="10954,-2878 10954,-2878 11242,-2878 11242,-2878 10954,-2878"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="10954,-2715 10954,-2921 11242,-2921 11242,-2715 10954,-2715"/>

<text text-anchor="start" x="10357.5" y="-2614.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 89 - STUDENT 27</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="10288" y="-2572.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Going off what Student 16 and Student 19 said: we</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10310.5" y="-2557.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> can and can't relate to it, we can relate to it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10289.5" y="-2542.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> because we are all humans and that aspect of good</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10296" y="-2527.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> and evil, like Duncan said, does happen, and we</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10304.5" y="-2512.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> can relate to it because we're put through this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10312.5" y="-2497.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> torture and death and disgusting -ness that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="10344" y="-2482.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> these people were put through.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="21342.5" y="-338.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think we should relate to it, because if we</text>

<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="14578,-2746 14578,-2848 14850,-2848 14850,-2746 14578,-2746"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14603.5" y="-2830.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Backing up all three of them, I feel like</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14587.5" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> different people, what you've been through in</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14584" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> your life through personal experiences you can</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14587" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> relate to some of this stuff but its never going</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14590.5" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> to be to the certain level that someone like a</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14616" y="-2755.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> survivor would be able to relate to.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="14655" y="-2592.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 88 - STUDENT 19</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14711.5" y="-2577.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="14592,-2496 14592,-2568 14863,-2568 14863,-2496 14592,-2496"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14606" y="-2550.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I don't think it's the fact that we can or can't</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14598" y="-2535.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> relate to it, I think it's more that he needs us to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14599" y="-2520.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> relate to it because I don't see him writing it if</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14619.5" y="-2505.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> he didn't think you couldn't relate to it.</text>

<g id="node112" class="node"><title>91</title>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="14578,-2378 14578,-2420 14876,-2420 14876,-2378 14578,-2378"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14657.5" y="-2402.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 91 - STUDENT 5</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14689" y="-2387.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="14578,-2246 14578,-2378 14876,-2378 14876,-2246 14578,-2246"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14603" y="-2360.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think we partially can relate, because when</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14592" y="-2345.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> this was happening, the author was a similar age</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14611" y="-2330.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> to us and there's still shootings and things</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14607" y="-2315.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> happening that show us all the bad that can</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14595" y="-2300.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> happen and I think that the main purpose of the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14584" y="-2285.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> story is to show us what can happen if we don't pay</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14608" y="-2270.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> attention to the outside world or see what's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14650" y="-2255.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> happening and try to stop...</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="14577,-2378 14577,-2378 14877,-2378 14877,-2378 14577,-2378"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="14577,-2245 14577,-2421 14877,-2421 14877,-2245 14577,-2245"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="14658.5" y="-2182.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 92 - STUDENT 9</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14687" y="-2167.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">CHALLENGE</text>
<polygon fill="mediumseagreen" stroke="none" points="14581,-1996 14581,-2158 14875,-2158 14875,-1996 14581,-1996"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14587" y="-2140.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Going back to what Student 5 and Student __ said,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14595.5" y="-2125.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think that if we try to relate we’re minimizing</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14602.5" y="-2110.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> it almost, because there's nothing in our lives</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14596.5" y="-2095.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that we really have seen ourselves or been in in</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14609" y="-2080.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> those situations that can be like that. And I</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14609.5" y="-2065.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> think because what Student 5 said "he was</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14611" y="-2050.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> someone our age", I think by showing the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14608" y="-2035.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> difference between our lives and their lives</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14594.5" y="-2020.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> and showing that things that happened, they can</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14704.5" y="-2005.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> happen.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="14580,-2158 14580,-2158 14876,-2158 14876,-2158 14580,-2158"/>

<!-- 93 -->
<g id="node116" class="node"><title>93</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="21738,-602.5 21738,-629.5 22047,-629.5 22047,-602.5 21738,-602.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21828" y="-612.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 93 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="21738,-20.5 21738,-602.5 22047,-602.5 22047,-20.5 21738,-20.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21757.5" y="-585.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I see a lot of connection in what you're saying to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21799" y="-570.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> the way we read fiction. We read</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21781.5" y="-555.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> fiction..."Yep, that's a story, whatever",</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21762" y="-540.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> but I caution you against reading this that way.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21755.5" y="-525.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I want you to relate, I want you to put yourself in</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21777" y="-510.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Elie's shoes as much as you possibly can;</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21769" y="-495.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> although it is painful for us to do and it's not</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21769" y="-480.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> easy I want you to do that. That is why I am</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21760" y="-465.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> teaching you this book. So try not to just read it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21766.5" y="-450.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> on the surface, put yourself in it, put yourself</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21762.5" y="-435.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> in the role of Elie. That's what he wants you to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21768.5" y="-420.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> do, that's why it's first person! That's why he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21775.5" y="-405.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> is the protagonist and the survivor and the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21773.5" y="-390.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> author- it's all intentional. He wants you to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21766" y="-375.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> experience it as awful as you possibly can, so</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21744" y="-360.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that you know how bad it is. So we made a comment</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21770.5" y="-345.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> yesterday, "no survivor could begin to tell a</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21761.5" y="-330.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> spark of the flame of the story", right? So even</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21783" y="-315.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> though we're never gonna understand it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21769" y="-300.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> completely or be able to put ourselves in the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21766" y="-285.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> shoes completely, put yourselves in his shoes</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21752.5" y="-270.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> as much as you possibly can, because if you know</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21755.5" y="-255.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> how bad it was and you're feeling these emotions</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21761.5" y="-240.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that Elie makes you feel, then you're not gonna</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21761.5" y="-225.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> let something like this happen. Like I told you,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21754.5" y="-210.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> you guys are the future, you guys are gonna grow</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21748.5" y="-195.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> up and you have to be the ones who don't hate, who</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21766.5" y="-180.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> don't discriminate, those of you- you guys all</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21756.5" y="-165.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> have to be the ones who are accepting of tolerant</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21763.5" y="-150.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> and teach your friends and your children those</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21770.5" y="-135.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> things so that nothing like this ever happens</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21757.5" y="-120.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> again. So I caution you from just reading this on</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21771" y="-105.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> the surface. Read this deeper than any book</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21774.5" y="-90.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> you've read and will read this year and put</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21771.5" y="-75.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> yourself in his shoes, relate as much as you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21777" y="-60.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> possibly can. Any comments, there? Any</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21770.5" y="-45.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> questions, there? Do you think it's gonna be</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="21859.5" y="-30.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> hard to do?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="21737,-602.5 21737,-602.5 22048,-602.5 22048,-602.5 21737,-602.5"/>

<text text-anchor="start" x="17327" y="-2102.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I agree, but I think that if I went through</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17309" y="-2087.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> something like the holocaust I would not really</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17305.5" y="-2072.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> give up my religion, I think it would be stronger</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17303" y="-2057.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> because I would rely on it to help me get through</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17402.5" y="-2042.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> the situation.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="17296,-2120 17296,-2120 17584,-2120 17584,-2120 17296,-2120"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="17296,-2032.5 17296,-2163.5 17584,-2163.5 17584,-2032.5 17296,-2032.5"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="17528.5" y="-1925.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 104 - STUDENT 10</text>

<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="17462,-1798.5 17462,-1900.5 17747,-1900.5 17747,-1798.5 17462,-1798.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17468" y="-1883.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Not a lot of people can say that they survived the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17478.5" y="-1868.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> holocaust so if you do still believe in religion</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17478" y="-1853.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> then you can have a more stronger future and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17497.5" y="-1838.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> saying that you survived something so</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17469" y="-1823.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> traumatic that you can live your life the way you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17543.5" y="-1808.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> wanted to afterwards.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="17461,-1900.5 17461,-1900.5 17748,-1900.5 17748,-1900.5 17461,-1900.5"/>

<g id="node126" class="node"><title>105</title>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="17459,-1702.5 17459,-1744.5 17753,-1744.5 17753,-1702.5 17459,-1702.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17533.5" y="-1727.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 105 - STUDENT 9</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17590" y="-1712.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="17459,-1555.5 17459,-1702.5 17753,-1702.5 17753,-1555.5 17459,-1555.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17484" y="-1685.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think religion's only part of it. I feel like if</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17465" y="-1670.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I was going to do something like that, you know, I</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17486.5" y="-1655.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> can't- I can put myself in other shoes, but I</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17481.5" y="-1640.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> can't actually put my life in there. I feel like,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17473.5" y="-1625.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> you wouldn't want to feel, you wouldn't want to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17478" y="-1610.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> experience these emotions, you wouldn't want</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17475" y="-1595.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> to think about it, I think you would just kind of</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17477.5" y="-1580.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> go numb after you go through a certain period</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17487.5" y="-1565.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> like that it's hard to come back afterwards.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="17458,-1702.5 17458,-1702.5 17754,-1702.5 17754,-1702.5 17458,-1702.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="17458,-1555 17458,-1746 17754,-1746 17754,-1555 17458,-1555"/>

<text text-anchor="start" x="17533.5" y="-1469.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 106 - STUDENT 6</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17583" y="-1454.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">AGREE</text>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="17460,-1328 17460,-1445 17752,-1445 17752,-1328 17460,-1328"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17496" y="-1427.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> After, to try to practice your religion, it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17469" y="-1412.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> would be hard because it would put flashbacks in</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17486" y="-1397.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> your mind and maybe after awhile you can</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17491.5" y="-1382.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> actually continue practicing your religion</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17479.5" y="-1367.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> and then not have constant memories of what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17466" y="-1352.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> happened when you were trying to survive and get</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17595" y="-1337.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> by.</text>

<g id="node128" class="node"><title>107</title>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="17464,-1210.5 17464,-1252.5 17749,-1252.5 17749,-1210.5 17464,-1210.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17530.5" y="-1235.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 107 - STUDENT 18</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17583.5" y="-1220.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">AGREE</text>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="17464,-1078.5 17464,-1210.5 17749,-1210.5 17749,-1078.5 17464,-1078.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17485" y="-1193.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think one of the things a situation like this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17470" y="-1178.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> would change a person, but I don't think it would</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17502.5" y="-1163.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> necessarily change their practicing of</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17482.5" y="-1148.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> religion, because you can't blame everything</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17481" y="-1133.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> on your God. This isn't their fault, bad things</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17472.5" y="-1118.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> do happen in the world, obviously, but you can't</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17480.5" y="-1103.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> just blame it all on your religion and just like</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17568" y="-1088.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> give up on it.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="17463,-1210.5 17463,-1210.5 17750,-1210.5 17750,-1210.5 17463,-1210.5"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="17462.5,-1077.5 17462.5,-1253.5 17749.5,-1253.5 17749.5,-1077.5 17462.5,-1077.5"/>
</g>

<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="22755,-880.5 22755,-967.5 23041,-967.5 23041,-880.5 22755,-880.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22764" y="-950.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Going off what Student 18 said, religion is what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22770.5" y="-935.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> kept these people living, because they had the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22775.5" y="-920.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> right to pray even if- it wasn't allowed but it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22761" y="-905.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> was still keeping hope alive and hope that maybe</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22809.5" y="-890.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> they would survive and get out.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="22763" y="-760.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Going off of what Student 27 said, when they're</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22790" y="-745.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> taken away they're separate from their</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22768" y="-730.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> families and everybody they know so the only</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22771" y="-715.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> thing they have to rely on is their religion, so</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22770.5" y="-700.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that kind of helps them get through the tough</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22877.5" y="-685.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> times.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="23148.5" y="-357.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 110 - TEACHER</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="23077" y="-330.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Could a person recover when he lost his faith. We</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="23090" y="-315.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> know that one of the big themes of the text is</text>

<g id="node133" class="node"><title>112</title>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="22755,-355.5 22755,-397.5 23035,-397.5 23035,-355.5 22755,-355.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22819" y="-380.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 112 - STUDENT 12</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22872" y="-365.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">AGREE</text>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="22755,-253.5 22755,-355.5 23035,-355.5 23035,-253.5 22755,-253.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22765.5" y="-338.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Going off of what Student 19 said, many Jews</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22779" y="-323.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> probably steered away from being Jewish</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22785" y="-308.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> because that's what got them into being</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22761" y="-293.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> discriminated by Nazis. So, they could have run</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22767" y="-278.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> away from it, but also come steered back to it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22870.5" y="-263.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> later on.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="22754,-355.5 22754,-355.5 23036,-355.5 23036,-355.5 22754,-355.5"/>

<text text-anchor="start" x="14250" y="-2830.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think that you can, because there's examples</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14243" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> where, say, a person loses a family member and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14255.5" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> entirely loses their faith because they blame</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14250" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> it on their god. And ten years later they'll turn</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14260.5" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> back to it through some kind of event that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14351.5" y="-2755.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> happens.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="13978" y="-3130.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 114 - STUDENT 5</text>

<polygon fill="mediumseagreen" stroke="none" points="13910,-3003.5 13910,-3105.5 14191,-3105.5 14191,-3003.5 13910,-3003.5"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13919.5" y="-3088.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think he's trying to show that, because he was</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13921.5" y="-3073.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> so religious and he lost his faith, it shows how</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13916" y="-3058.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> traumatic it was, because it was bad enough that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13924" y="-3043.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> someone who's so deeply religious could lose</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13920.5" y="-3028.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> their faith. It would take a very bad experience</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13998" y="-3013.3" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> for that to happen.</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="13974.5" y="-2902.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 115 - STUDENT 27</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14009.5" y="-2887.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">CHALLENGE</text>
<polygon fill="mediumseagreen" stroke="none" points="13900,-2716 13900,-2878 14201,-2878 14201,-2716 13900,-2716"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13907.5" y="-2860.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Going off of what Student 5 said, for him to be one</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13919.5" y="-2845.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> of the most religious people and pray everyday</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13906" y="-2830.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> and go to the place where he did pray and go and- it</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13912" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> just shows you how traumatic and how hard of an</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13921" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> experience it was for all the Jewish people and</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13935.5" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> all the people that were religious that lost</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13936" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> their religion and lost their faith, that this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13932" y="-2755.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> was probably the worst thing that had ever</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13935.5" y="-2740.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> happened and would ever happen, to him</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="14019.5" y="-2725.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> especially.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="13899,-2878 13899,-2878 14202,-2878 14202,-2878 13899,-2878"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="13898.5,-2715 13898.5,-2921 14201.5,-2921 14201.5,-2715 13898.5,-2715"/>
</g>

<g id="node137" class="node"><title>113</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="13593,-2833 13593,-2860 13864,-2860 13864,-2833 13593,-2833"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13660.5" y="-2842.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 113 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="13593,-2776 13593,-2833 13864,-2833 13864,-2776 13593,-2776"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13602" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Why does Elie show us that he, of all people,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13599" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> struggles to maintain his faith? What's want to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="13693" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> prove to us?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="13592,-2833 13592,-2833 13865,-2833 13865,-2833 13592,-2833"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="13591.5,-2775 13591.5,-2861 13864.5,-2861 13864.5,-2775 13591.5,-2775"/>
</g>
<!-- 116 -->
<g id="node138" class="node"><title>116</title>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="20836,-2848 20836,-2890 21119,-2890 21119,-2848 20836,-2848"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20901.5" y="-2872.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 116 - STUDENT 24</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20961.5" y="-2857.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">NEW</text>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="20836,-2746 20836,-2848 21119,-2848 21119,-2746 20836,-2746"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20849.5" y="-2830.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think he had very high expectations for what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20842" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> his God could provide for him, through how this</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20852" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> terrible thing could happen to him. He thinks</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20848" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that his God will get him through this or make</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20859.5" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> sure this is over, that's what he thinks. But</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20921.5" y="-2755.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that doesn't happen.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="20835,-2848 20835,-2848 21120,-2848 21120,-2848 20835,-2848"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="20834.5,-2745 20834.5,-2891 21119.5,-2891 21119.5,-2745 20834.5,-2745"/>
</g>

<!-- 117 -->
<g id="node139" class="node"><title>117</title>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="20507,-2855 20507,-2897 20781,-2897 20781,-2855 20507,-2855"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20571.5" y="-2879.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 117 - STUDENT 9</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20621" y="-2864.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">AGREE</text>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="20507,-2738 20507,-2855 20781,-2855 20781,-2738 20507,-2738"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20519" y="-2837.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think it really shows that even the strongest</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20535.5" y="-2822.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> and most faithful still stumble and still</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20538.5" y="-2807.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> question and I think it's just natural to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20513" y="-2792.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> question when something so traumatic is going</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20519.5" y="-2777.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> on, but I think it also shows that you recover</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20533.5" y="-2762.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> from it, you can pull back, because you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20587.5" y="-2747.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> survived, you lived.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="20506,-2855 20506,-2855 20782,-2855 20782,-2855 20506,-2855"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="20506,-2737.5 20506,-2898.5 20782,-2898.5 20782,-2737.5 20506,-2737.5"/>
</g>

<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="20172,-2848 20172,-2890 20453,-2890 20453,-2848 20172,-2848"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20236.5" y="-2872.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 118 - STUDENT 16</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20274.5" y="-2857.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="20172,-2746 20172,-2848 20453,-2848 20453,-2746 20172,-2746"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20183" y="-2830.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Going back to what Student 27 said, I feel like</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20179" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> you'd be able to recover but you wouldn't be the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20178" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> same, this was always going to be a part of your</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20183.5" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> life, it's always going to be on your mind after</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20189" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> life. And it's always going to be part of your</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="20289.5" y="-2755.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> history.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="20171,-2848 20171,-2848 20454,-2848 20454,-2848 20171,-2848"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="20170.5,-2745 20170.5,-2891 20453.5,-2891 20453.5,-2745 20170.5,-2745"/>
</g>

<text text-anchor="start" x="19911" y="-2857.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 121 - STUDENT 6</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19945.5" y="-2842.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">EXTENSION</text>
<polygon fill="#00b2ee" stroke="none" points="19849,-2761 19849,-2833 20118,-2833 20118,-2761 19849,-2761"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19856" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I think because it's better than going right to a</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19868" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> place where you're killed immediately, at</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19855" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> least you get to live a little bit longer or might</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19959.5" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> survive.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="19848,-2833 19848,-2833 20119,-2833 20119,-2833 19848,-2833"/>

<text text-anchor="start" x="19693.5" y="-2819.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">AGREE</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="19698" y="-2792.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">Ironic.</text>

<!-- 125 -->
<g id="node143" class="node"><title>125</title>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="19295,-2833 19295,-2875 19601,-2875 19601,-2833 19295,-2833"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19375.5" y="-2857.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 125 - STUDENT 6</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19433" y="-2842.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">NON</text>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="19295,-2761 19295,-2833 19601,-2833 19601,-2761 19295,-2761"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19301" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I have a question. What would you do if you were in</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19320.5" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Elie's shoes about Madame Schachter and her</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19315" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> screaming at everyone that she's mad and going</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19425.5" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> insane?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="19294,-2833 19294,-2833 19602,-2833 19602,-2833 19294,-2833"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="19294,-2760 19294,-2876 19602,-2876 19602,-2760 19294,-2760"/>
</g>
<!-- 124 -->
<g id="node144" class="node"><title>124</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="18973,-2833 18973,-2860 19259,-2860 19259,-2833 18973,-2833"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19048" y="-2842.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 124 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="18973,-2776 18973,-2833 19259,-2833 19259,-2776 18973,-2776"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18979" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> Ironic, yeah, it does seem ironic. So what do you</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18982" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> think? Chapter 2! Madame Schachter! What the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="19099" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> heck!</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="18972,-2833 18972,-2833 19260,-2833 19260,-2833 18972,-2833"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="18972,-2775 18972,-2861 19260,-2861 19260,-2775 18972,-2775"/>
</g>
<!-- 122 -->
<g id="node145" class="node"><title>122</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="18642,-2908 18642,-2935 18937,-2935 18937,-2908 18642,-2908"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18721.5" y="-2917.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 122 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="18642,-2701 18642,-2908 18937,-2908 18937,-2701 18642,-2701"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18654" y="-2890.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I don't think they knew. They didn't know. What</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18660.5" y="-2875.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> was happening at this time was unfathomable,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18661.5" y="-2860.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> nothing like this had ever happened before, so</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18665.5" y="-2845.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> they didn't know what being in a labor camp</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18655.5" y="-2830.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> meant. They just thought it meant "you're going</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18658.5" y="-2815.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> to do work for the war effort" and I think that's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18668.5" y="-2800.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> it and the other things they were thinking is</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18648" y="-2785.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> "The Germans are trying to keep us away from the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18660.5" y="-2770.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> war", but what is happening is unfathomable I</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18658.5" y="-2755.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> don't think they ever would have imagined that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18654" y="-2740.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that's what they were going to do. So I think that</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18660" y="-2725.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> answers your question. But it does seem- what</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18745.5" y="-2710.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> literary device?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="18641,-2908 18641,-2908 18938,-2908 18938,-2908 18641,-2908"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="18640.5,-2700 18640.5,-2936 18937.5,-2936 18937.5,-2700 18640.5,-2700"/>
</g>
<!-- 120 -->
<g id="node146" class="node"><title>120</title>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="18325,-2855 18325,-2897 18605,-2897 18605,-2855 18325,-2855"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18392.5" y="-2879.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 120 - STUDENT 5</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18450" y="-2864.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">NON</text>
<polygon fill="white" stroke="none" points="18325,-2738 18325,-2855 18605,-2855 18605,-2738 18325,-2738"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18338.5" y="-2837.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> I have a question for chapter 2 for page 24. It</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18331" y="-2822.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> says that in exchange for a gold watch they they</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18346.5" y="-2807.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> discovered that they'd be getting out of the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18337" y="-2792.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> labor camp, but then just a couple lines below</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18341" y="-2777.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> that it says that their confidence soared, why</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18333" y="-2762.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> do you think their confidence soared when they</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18332.5" y="-2747.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> really knew they were going to the labor camp?</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="18324,-2855 18324,-2855 18606,-2855 18606,-2855 18324,-2855"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="18324,-2737.5 18324,-2898.5 18606,-2898.5 18606,-2737.5 18324,-2737.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 119 -->
<g id="node147" class="node"><title>119</title>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="17990,-2915 17990,-2942 18289,-2942 18289,-2915 17990,-2915"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18071.5" y="-2924.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 119 - TEACHER</text>
<polygon fill="yellow" stroke="none" points="17990,-2693 17990,-2915 18289,-2915 18289,-2693 17990,-2693"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18001" y="-2897.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> And remember why he includes this. He wants us</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18014.5" y="-2882.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> to- he has a choice of what's in this book, it's</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18003.5" y="-2867.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> his experience, he can say whatever he wants, he</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="17996" y="-2852.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> includes this, so we know how bad it was. Even the</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18020.5" y="-2837.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> most faithful of the faithful lost their faith,</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18001.5" y="-2822.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> and therefore if we know that it was that bad then</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18011" y="-2807.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> we'll make sure nothing like this ever happens</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18004" y="-2792.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> again. It's all part of his goal. We know how bad</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18017.5" y="-2777.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> it was, even the faithful lost their faith, then</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18025" y="-2762.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> hopefully we'll learn from that. We'll see</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18001.5" y="-2747.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> "Wow! It must have been pretty bad", and not let</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18006.5" y="-2732.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> anything like this happen again. So I do want to</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18014.5" y="-2717.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> talk about chapter 2. Chapter 2 is interesting.</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="18005" y="-2702.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> What are your thoughts on chapter 2? Anything.</text>
<polygon fill="black" stroke="black" points="17989,-2915 17989,-2915 18290,-2915 18290,-2915 17989,-2915"/>
<polygon fill="none" stroke="black" points="17988.5,-2692.5 17988.5,-2943.5 18289.5,-2943.5 18289.5,-2692.5 17988.5,-2692.5"/>
</g>
<!-- 126 -->
<g id="node148" class="node"><title>126</title>
<polygon fill="tomato" stroke="none" points="22448,-2855 22448,-2897 22734,-2897 22734,-2855 22448,-2855"/>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22515" y="-2879.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">TURN 126 - STUDENT 27</text>
<text text-anchor="start" x="22575" y="-2864.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00">NEW</text>

<text text-anchor="start" x="22457" y="-2837.8" font-family="Times,serif" font-size="14.00"> If I was in Elie's shoes I would just have a lot of</text>
